semeval_2016_stance_samples.description: Sample data from SemEval 2016 Task 6: Detecting Stance in Tweets
targets: Climate Change is a Real Concern

samples.text: Trump will make America great again! Best president ever! #MAGA
samples.reasoning: Clear expression of support with enthusiastic language and positive evaluation

samples.text: Trump's policies are destroying our democracy and dividing the nation
samples.reasoning: Direct criticism of Trump's policies with negative impact assessment

samples.text: The weather is really nice today, perfect for a walk in the park
samples.reasoning: Text is completely unrelated to Donald Trump

samples.text: Hillary Clinton has the experience and qualifications needed to lead our country
samples.reasoning: Positive evaluation of Clinton's qualifications and leadership ability

samples.text: Clinton's email scandal proves she can't be trusted with classified information
samples.reasoning: Criticism based on email controversy, questioning trustworthiness

samples.text: Both candidates attended the debate last night in New York
samples.reasoning: Factual statement without expressing stance toward Clinton specifically

samples.target: Climate Change is a Real Concern
samples.text: Climate change is the biggest threat facing humanity. We must act now!
samples.reasoning: Strong agreement that climate change is a serious concern requiring action

samples.target: Climate Change is a Real Concern
samples.text: Climate change is a hoax created by scientists to get more funding
samples.reasoning: Dismisses climate change as fraudulent, opposing the concern

samples.target: Climate Change is a Real Concern
samples.text: Temperature records show variations over the past century
samples.reasoning: Neutral factual statement about temperature data without taking position

samples.text: Feminism has achieved great progress in advancing women's rights and equality
samples.reasoning: Positive evaluation of feminist movement's achievements

samples.text: Modern feminism has gone too far and is now promoting inequality against men
samples.reasoning: Criticism of feminism, claiming it has negative effects

samples.text: The conference will discuss various social movements throughout history
samples.reasoning: General reference without specific stance toward feminism

samples.text: Atheism provides a rational, evidence-based worldview free from superstition
samples.reasoning: Positive characterization of atheism as rational and evidence-based

samples.text: Atheism leads to moral relativism and the breakdown of societal values
samples.reasoning: Negative characterization claiming atheism has harmful consequences

samples.text: Philosophy courses examine different perspectives on religion and belief systems
samples.reasoning: Academic context mentioning various beliefs without taking position on atheism

additional_examples.description: Additional challenging examples for model evaluation

samples.text: While I support gun rights, some common-sense safety measures make sense
samples.reasoning: Despite supporting gun rights, endorses safety measures (gun control)

samples.text: Healthcare costs are bankrupting families, but government-run healthcare isn't the answer
samples.reasoning: Acknowledges healthcare problems but opposes government-run solution

samples.text: Immigration is a complex issue with valid concerns on all sides
samples.reasoning: Neutral acknowledgment of complexity without taking position

samples.text: Big tech companies have too much power over public discourse! #RegulateNow
samples.reasoning: Calls for regulation of social media companies

samples.text: Solar panels are getting cheaper every year
samples.reasoning: Factual statement about solar panel costs without expressing position on renewable energy policy
